cards.name: Beedrill V

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Swarming Sting
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Beedrill V in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hisuian Voltorb
cards.text: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

attacks.name: Cheerful Charge
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Hisuian Electrode
cards.text: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Wide Wing
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Heracross
cards.text: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kricketot
cards.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Kricketune

abilities.name: Swelling Tune
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon in play, except any Kricketune, get +40 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Swelling Tune Ability at a time.

cards.text: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.

cards.name: Combee
cards.text: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.

attacks.name: Honey Courier
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Vespiquen
cards.text: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.

attacks.name: Honey Rush
attacks.text: Reveal any number of Sweet Honey cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you revealed in this way.

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.

attacks.name: Energy Garden
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leafy Cyclone
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

attacks.name: Encouraging Gift
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hisuian Lilligant
cards.text: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

attacks.name: Twister Lutz
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hisuian Lilligant V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dance Gracefully
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Hisuian Lilligant VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Perfume
abilities.text: During your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 in any combination of Grass Pokémon and Grass Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Parallel Spin
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. If you do, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Rowlet
cards.text: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Dartrix
cards.text: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.

cards.name: Rapidash
cards.text: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Cyndaquil
cards.text: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

attacks.name: Charge Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Quilava
cards.text: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

cards.name: Heatran V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Burn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magma Fall
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Heatran VMAX

abilities.name: Magma Gain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have a Stadium in play, you may heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Heat Burst
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Radiant Heatran
cards.text: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Raging Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

attacks.name: Entangled Dive
attacks.text: Discard each player's Active Pokémon and all attached cards. (You choose a new Active Pokémon first.)

cards.name: Starmie V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Spiral
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Swinub
cards.text: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Piloswine
cards.text: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Mamoswine
cards.text: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Iceberg Press
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Mantine
cards.text: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

attacks.name: Borne Ashore
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto that player's Bench.

cards.name: Barboach
cards.text: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.

cards.name: Whiscash
cards.text: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Regice
cards.text: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.

attacks.name: Regi Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Blizzard Bind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon V, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Glaceon
cards.text: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.

attacks.name: Frost Wall

cards.name: Origin Forme Palkia V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Subspace Swell
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name "scalchop.".

cards.name: Dewott
cards.text: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Hisuian Basculin
cards.text: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

attacks.name: Gather the Crew
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Hisuian Basculegion
cards.text: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

attacks.name: Grudge Dive
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

attacks.name: Line Force
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Radiant Greninja

cards.text: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bergmite
cards.text: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

cards.name: Hisuian Avalugg

abilities.name: Massive Ice
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

attacks.name: Mountain Gale
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium.

cards.name: Galarian Mr. Rime V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Radiating Pulse
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Regieleki
cards.text: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It's said that removing the rings on Regieleki's body will unleash the Pokémon's latent power.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Sonar

attacks.name: Targeted Bolt

cards.name: Hisuian Typhlosion

abilities.name: Supernatural Orb
abilities.text: You must discard a Psychic Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Confused.

cards.text: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Hisuian Typhlosion V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Hisuian Typhlosion VSTAR

cards.name: Togepi

abilities.name: Touch of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

cards.name: Togetic

abilities.name: Voice of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 30 damage from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

cards.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Shine of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 90 damage from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they've hardly been seen at all.

cards.name: Misdreavus
cards.text: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

cards.name: Mismagius
cards.text: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

attacks.name: Ominous Prose
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If they have 4 or more cards in their hand, choose all but 3, and your opponent shuffles the chosen cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Kirlia
cards.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.

attacks.name: Swirling Slice

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Drifblim
cards.text: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.

attacks.name: Spooky Balloon
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

attacks.name: Wise Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Mental Shroud
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.text: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

cards.name: Azelf
cards.text: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Basic Pokémon.

cards.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

abilities.name: Hurried Gait
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw a card.

cards.text: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Hisuian Growlithe
cards.text: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

attacks.name: Defensive Posture
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.text: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

cards.name: Sudowoodo

abilities.name: Vamoose
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.text: Every bit of Regirock's body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what's been lost.

cards.text: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

cards.text: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.

cards.name: Hippowdon
cards.text: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.

cards.text: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

cards.text: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.
